title: Foundation in IT and Networking
description: Start with a strong foundation in general IT. A G.C.E. A/L in a Maths or Technology stream is helpful. Focus on understanding operating systems (especially Linux), computer networks, and basic programming concepts.
institutes: Online platforms like TryHackMe, Hack The Box

title: Formal Education and Foundational Certifications
description: Pursue a degree or higher diploma in IT, Cybersecurity, or Computer Science. Complement your studies with globally recognized entry-level cybersecurity certifications.

title: Security Operations Center (SOC) Analyst
description: Gain hands-on experience in a SOC. In this role, you will monitor security alerts, investigate potential incidents, and use security tools like SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) to protect the organization's assets. This is the core entry-point for most cybersecurity careers.

title: Advanced Analyst Roles: Threat Hunter / Incident Responder
description: Move into a more specialized and proactive analyst role. A Threat Hunter actively searches for threats that have bypassed automated defenses. An Incident Responder leads the effort to contain and eradicate threats during an active security breach.
institutes: Specialized security teams in large corporations and tech companies

title: Cybersecurity Consultant / Architect
description: Advance to a senior role where you advise companies on their overall security posture, design secure systems and architectures, and help them achieve compliance with standards like ISO 27001. This is a senior advisory and design role.
